VASSAL_RETRACTION_LOG: $TOP_LIEGE$ has retracted the vassalage of $VASSAL$ from $OLD_LIEGE$
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_LONG_DESC: You can retract a vassal from one of your direct vassals. They will not be happy about this, especially if it is their de jure vassal.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_0: Select a vassal to retract from §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_1: Make §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W your direct vassal, decreasing §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W's opinion of you by §R$OPINION$§W.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_2: Thanks to the crown authority in the §Y$CROWN_TITLE$§!, our vassals cannot object.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_2B: Since §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a traitor, our vassals will not object.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_2C: Since §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a filthy §Y[Recipient.Religion.GetName]§!, our vassals will not object.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_2D: This is a breach of the feudal contract and will upset your other vassals (§R$OPINION$§!).
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_2E: Our Imperial administration allows us to retract vassals without objections from the aristocracy.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_ACCEPT_LOG: §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W has transferred the vassalage of §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W from §Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§W
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_LETTER: We have decided to retract the vassalage of [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]. Failure to accept will lead to war.
RETRACT_VASSAL_INTERACTION_DECLINE_LOG: §Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§W refused the retraction of the vassal §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W, demanded by §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W
EVTDESC274: My liege, I accept your decision to retract my vassal, [Root.GetBestName], though it grieves me deeply.
EVTDESC275: Your breach of the feudal contract is unacceptable, I will not give up my vassals without a fight!
CANNOT_DESTROY_GAVELKIND_TITLE: Cannot destroy titles under Gavelkind succession
hellenic_pagan_DESC:
The Hellenistic religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Jupiter, Mars, Mercury, Venus, Minerva and Vesta. It originated in ancient Greece and with the conquests of Alexander the Great and the Roman Empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the Mediterranean world until the rise of Christendom. Defining features in-game: 
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
pagan_DESC:
Since the dawn of history, both Europe and the Middle East has been home to countless Pagan religions and cults unrelated to the Abrahamic faiths. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
